lines.text: There was only one assassination attempt on me. You had three.
Two. The woman in Phoenix doesn't count. She only had a starter pistol.
A cookbook. He wrote a cookbook. How dare he?
Well, you know, when he was President, he did cook for his guests all the time.
That's not the point. Did George Washington write a book called "Your Wooden Teeth and You?" Did William Howard Taft write "Thirty Days To A Slimmer Ass?" It's shameful, just shameful.
[Russell Kramer's made-up words to "Hail to the Chief."]
Hail to the chief, he's the chief and he needs hailing. He is the chief, so everybody hail like crazy. Hail to... that's more or less how it...
I was Time Magazine's Man of the Year.
So was Hitler.
Not twice.
When you were in the White House, who was the person you were most excited to meet?
Nelson Mandela.
I'm not a reporter.
Ella Fitzgerald.
Ah.
Mandela was a great man, but he couldn't sing worth a shit.
It's an honor, sir.
I can't shake right now. Have to keep my hands on the First Penis.
When this is over, promise me we'll come back and look for my balls.
Don't say "freaking", Russ. If you have to use the "F" word, go for the gold.
That went a little too easy. You guys are getting soft.
Mr. President, once again, we really wish you wouldn't do that. You put yourself at great risk, sir.
Oh, yeah, right. Let me ask you something. In all the years ex-presidents have had Secret Service protection, has there ever been even one assassination attempt on any of 'em?
Uh, no, sir.
I find that sad. The minute you're out of office they don't care enough about you to kill you anymore. People are FICKLE.

I'm so sorry, and I'm so embarrassed. I hope this doesn't scare you away from golf... Because it's such a great sport! I-I know your people... the black people, don't really enjoy the game, but I think that's because you can't get into the nice clubs! The restricted ones. And on the other hand, your people are so good at so many sports, that maybe it's good that we white folks have a sport that you people are not so good at!
Mr. Vice President, please step this way.
Why? Is there a problem?
There will be less of one if you step this way.
Just get out of the chopper!
What?
Get out of the chopper!
The crops?
GET OUT!
Well, I don't think you had anything to do with Charlie's death, but I'm pretty sure you're involved in this mess somehow.
I'm involved? But, what about you? You were the one sittin' in the car next to a dead man.
Well, now you know. I enjoy spending time with dead men. You don't believe me? Go ahead and die. It'll perk me right up.
Look, Joanna, if the book goes, if it doesn't go, I don't really care. I'm only writing it 'cause, frankly, I don't know what else to do.
I'm sure you've got plenty of options.

Not really. But I'll tell you one thing, I'll never be like Kramer, running around the country sucking up every dime that isn't nailed down. Now Jimmy Carter, there's a class act. He goes around building homes for poor people with his own hands. That's classy.
Well, you could do that.
Yeah, yeah. Maybe in a couple of years, but, uh, right now, my attitude is, they didn't vote for me, let 'em freeze.
Did you ever have one of her pizzas?
Oh.
It was like a wet dream with a crust.
A wet dream?
Huh?
I don't think I need to hear Russell P. Kramer saying the words "wet dream." I'll wake up screaming every night 'til I die.
You're a whore. Admit it. Admit you're a big whore. Go ahead.
Name three women from the District of Columbia that you didn't bang when you were in office - what am I talking about? Name one.
Screw you.
Blow me.
[Rifles fire]

[Arguing with Kramer while trying to figure out what happened to Charlie Reynolds]
Oh you're right! We got into an argument about your cookbook and I plugged him!

[Meeting in the Oval office with the presidents]
We've met before sir
I don't think so
Oh we have sir, somewhere...
[pause]
over the rainbow
[raises eyebrows and nod slightly]
[last lines]
Hey, money! Did you drop that?
Yeah, that's mine.
My fellow Americans!
You son of a...
Russell, I have just one thing to ask... when you dance with a panda, who leads?

[after Wayne gives a confused, inaccurate depiction of what he thinks Mt. Rushmore will be like]
You've gotta' be kidding, right, Wayne? You've got Lincoln mixed up with George Washington, and you've got the Roosevelts mixed up with Davy Crockett. Do you have *any* idea what you're talking about?
Uh, no disrespect, sir, but you're in my car.
Well, you're in my country - *our* country. Get your facts straight! How do you expect your son to respect the nation's history if *you* don't? That kind of ignorance is dangerous!

Forget our nation's history... what about our nation right now? The country's fallin' apart, people losin' their homes. They can't find work. You talk about ignorance, *you're* the ignorant ones, both of you. Why, you've... you've ignored the voice of the people!

[Slightly incredulous]
Oh, the "voice of the people"? There is no such thing! You've got 240 million voices all yellin' for something different. The only thing you all seem to agree on is you don't want higher taxes. "The voice of the people" my fanny!
Pull over, Wayne.
Please get out of our car.
Listen, I'm sorry...
No... We invited you into our home. Not our car, our home.

[addressing Kramer]
We lost our jobs because of your budget cuts, President Cramer.

[addressing Douglas]
And we lost our home, because of your economic downturn, President Douglas.
Please, get out of our car.
Hello, sirs. No need for concern. It's only me... the twisted psycho.
Don't do that with the liquor, Russ. It's so... George Bush.
It's a kick in the balls. Sorry, sweetheart.
Please, I'm a politician's wife. I have a set of my own.
Oh, yeah, I'm about to share my coffee with the Washington Love Machine. No dice. You could spit in a Petri dish and start a whole new civilization.
[Matt Douglas' made-up words to "Hail to the Chief"]
Hail to the chief, if you don't, I'll have to kill you. I am the chief, so you better watch your step, you bastards.
Well, as usual, the Republican comes up with a plan while the Democrat just aimlessly wanders in the woods.
Wel... , uh, I'm sorry about that, sir. We're Republican.
Well, at least you can admit it. That's the first step towards recovery.
Kaye. What a... lovely surprise. And how is my favorite television newsperson?
Oh, I'm your favorite? I thought Diane Sawyer was your favorite.
She is. How is she?
I hate these funerals. It's just awful when another good Democrat passes on.
I believe the deceased was a Republican, sir.
Oh, well, then it might not be so bad.
Sir, uh, before we go in, Chet and I would really like to know how you got out of that bathroom stall without us seeing.
Why don't you guys just relax? Take a night off. Go rent "In The Line of Fire" again.

[about his "Constellation" watch]
Oh, this really steams my clams. There are only two watches like that in the entire world. Reagan has one, and now Shamu, the killer hick, has the other.
Oh, geez... he's squeezin' my breast again.
Well, this time, pretend not to enjoy it.
The people will believe us!
Why
Because we're presidents
[long silence]
Okay they won't believe us... what the hell are we supposed to do now?

[Presidents Douglas and Kramer lead a White House tour as fast as possible in order to get to the Oval Office in time]
Okay, this is the Green Room...

[No pause]
It's green.

[No pause]
And its a room.

[No pause]
Hence its name.

[No pause]
Any questions?

[No pause]
None from me.

[No pause, both Presidents start to move on down the hall]
Okay, then shall we?

[after talking about Jimmy Carter being a class act with Habitat for Humanity]
I could do that. But right now, my attitude is, they didn't vote for me, let 'em freeze.
[smiles]

[Jim is a Caucasian Secret Serivce agent]
Sir, message from the President.
Oh, thanks Jim.
Jim's off today, Sir. I'm Bruce.
Oh, sorrry. You and Jim look very much alike.
Jim's Black, Sir.
I'm not ashamed to say it, I've slept with both those guys.

[after driving off the tee]
You know, I've actually thought about playing professionally.
Well, gee, I don't know about that, Bill. I think the ladies' tour likes their players to be a little more masculine.
When it comes time for a rest, there's no place like Cleveland.
Well, Kaye. What an unexpected and bloodcurdling surprise.
You just know how to make a girl get all gooey inside, don't you. What have you heard about the Kramer scandal?
Not a word. Now if you'll excuse me, my salad's getting cold.
[White House worker notices the gun in Rita's station wagon]
What you looking at? You been down to that farmer's market lately? It's brutal.
Wait a minute. Is that President Kramer holding a gun on a naked guy in a blindfold?
Decaf. You pussy.
Let's stop talking. We're about to bond. It'll make me vomit.
We're never getting to Ohio, not the way this guy drives. Every 500 feet, they stop to take another damn picture. The Donner Party moved faster.

[after smuggling the Presidents in hidden by a tarp past the White house guard]
Mr Presidents, please hush up! Long as you're in my car you're produce!
Nice going Mario
Shut up!
[first lines]

It has been described as one of the most vicious presidential races in the history of American politics, and one of the closest. The Republican nominee, Senator Russell P Kramer of Ohio, is practically dead even in the polls with his bitter rival, Democratic Governor Matt Douglas of Indiana. To say there is no love lost between these two candidates is a gross understatement. And yet tonight, in spite of their almost overwhelming distaste for each other, one of these men will have to salute the other as the next president of the United States.

[Picks up talking President Kramer doll at the Kramer Library gift shop]
Oh, you gotta be kidding me

[Kramer's voice after Douglas pulls the doll's string]
"Our dreams are like our children."
Ah,huh?

[Kramer's voice after Douglas pulls the doll's string again]
"Don't you fall into the trap. Democrats are full of crap."
Anything you like I can get for you at cost.

[Drops the doll]
I feel dirty.

[to the pilots after commandeering the helicopter]
You guys said you need to maintain radio silence?
[Shoots the radio]
Douglas, you shouldn't fire off a gun in an enclosed area. You could cause permanent hearing damage!
Get out of the cockpit.

[loudly]
What?

[louder]
Get out of the cockpit!
The crops?
GET OUT!
